title: Object-Oriented Programming
description: This course will expose students to programming practices beyond the introductory level, concentrating on Object Oriented Programming techniques and an introduction to Data Structures. Students will also study and analyze the complexity of both the algorithms presented in class and of the algorithms they develop.
prerequisites: CICS 110 or COMPSCI 121 with a grade of C or better

title: Data Structures
description: An introduction to the design, analysis, and implementation of data structures. Topics include binary search trees, balanced trees, priority queues, hash tables, graphs, and more. Students will learn to analyze the performance of algorithms using Big-O notation.
prerequisites: CICS 160 with a grade of C or better

title: Make: A Hands-on Introduction to Physical Computing
description: This course provides a hands-on introduction to physical computing with Arduinos, sensing and responding to the physical world, and rapid prototyping. A required lab section is included.
prerequisites: CICS 210 or COMPSCI 187 with a grade of C or better

title: Social Issues in Computing
description: A discussion-based course on computing issues in modern society, exploring topics such as ethics, privacy, and the impact of technology.
prerequisites: ENGLWRIT 112 with a grade of C or better
COMPSCI 220
COMPSCI 230
COMPSCI 240

title: Introduction to Programming
description: An introduction to computer programming using Python, covering data types, program structures, functions, debugging, and object-oriented programming.

title: Practicum - Introduction to the C Programming Language
description: Covers basic C data types, functions, pointers, and memory management. Students learn to compile and run C programs.
prerequisites: CICS 160 or COMPSCI 121 with a grade of B or better

title: Programming Methodology
description: Covers design strategies and patterns, functional and object-oriented approaches, program verification, and testing.
prerequisites: CICS 210 with a grade of C or better

title: Computer Systems Principles
description: A study of high-performance, scalable systems, C data representation, assembly languages, operating system services, and synchronization.
prerequisites: CICS 210 with a grade of C or better
COMPSCI 198C

title: Introduction to Algorithms
description: Covers algorithm design techniques such as divide and conquer, greedy methods, dynamic programming, and network flow.
prerequisites: CICS 210
COMPSCI 250 or MATH 455 with a grade of C or better

title: Introduction to Software Engineering
description: Focuses on team-based software engineering projects covering design, abstraction, testing, and project management.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 220 with a grade of C or better

title: Web Programming
description: Introduction to client-side and server-side web technologies, including JavaScript, AJAX, web security, and web frameworks.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 220 or COMPSCI 230 with a grade of C or better

title: Introduction to Computer and Network Security
description: Covers cryptography, privacy, network security, security vulnerabilities, and countermeasures.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 230 with a grade of C or better

title: Reverse Engineering and Understanding Exploit Development
description: Covers practical skills in reverse engineering and binary exploitation, including vulnerability analysis and mitigation techniques.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 230 (or E&C-ENG 322 or E&C-ENG 373) with a grade of C or better, or permission of instructor

title: Introduction to Computer Vision
description: Covers algorithms for image processing, object recognition, and machine learning applications in vision.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 240 or 383 with a grade of C or better

title: Introduction to Computer Graphics
description: Introduces 2D and 3D computer graphics, including modeling, rendering, shading, and ray tracing.
prerequisites: CICS 210 (or COMPSCI 187) and MATH 235 (or INFO 150 or COMPSCI 240) with a grade of C or better

title: Operating Systems
description: Examines the design and implementation of modern operating systems, including processes, memory management, and file systems.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 230 with a grade of C or better

title: Artificial Intelligence
description: Provides an introduction to AI topics, with a focus on machine learning, search algorithms, and neural networks.
prerequisites: CICS 210 and COMPSCI 240 (or STATISTC 315), all with a grade of C or better

title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: An introduction to machine learning algorithms including supervised learning, reinforcement learning, and deep learning concepts.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 220 (or COMPSCI 230), COMPSCI 240 (or STATISTC 315/515), and MATH 233, all with a grade of C or better

title: Harnessing Data Science for Societal Good
description: Project-based course on data science applications in societal problems like sustainability and healthcare.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 230 and COMPSCI 240 (or STATISTC 315/515) with a grade of C or better

title: Introduction to Robotics: Perception, Mechanics, Dynamics, and Control
description: Covers robotic motion, kinematics, dynamics, and feedback control with programming in Python.
prerequisites: MATH 235 and COMPSCI 220 (or COMPSCI 230) with a grade of C or better

title: Software Entrepreneurship
description: Focuses on developing software from proof-of-concept to marketable products with societal benefits.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 320 (or COMPSCI 326) with a grade of C or better

title: Scalable Web Systems
description: Covers large-scale web applications, software architecture, scalability, and distributed systems.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 320 or COMPSCI 326 with a grade of C or better

title: Software Engineering Project Management
description: Provides practical experience in managing software development projects for teams.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 320 with a grade of B or better, or instructor permission
